instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: 3437 no orange light
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in with liquid damage.  pp3v42 was short and <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> was corded.  swapped it out and got orange light along with fan spin.  thew it in the ultrasonic and now don't have orange light again.  i tried changing <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> but still no orange light. i checked diode mode on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and no beeps.

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> voltages:
1- 0v
2-16.4v
3-4.375
9-.034v
12-3.4v
13-.09v
14-3.387v
15-.056v
17-8.18v
19-5.038v
20-5.038v
27-16.2v

resistance 
17/18 - 3.5ohm
27/28 - 26ohm

threads.title: 3437 no orange light
threads.message:
Did you try another LIO flex/board?
Inspect J9500 pins for corrosion.
Check continuity for <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>, between MLB and LIO board.

threads.title: 3437 no orange light
threads.message:
tried with new flex and board,
no corrosion on j9500 pins
pp3v42 - i have 3.417v
i tested continuity from j9500 to smc testpoint for sysonewire
smcbc acok -

threads.title: 3437 no orange light
threads.message: found the issue. <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> was giving me issues.  <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> was half solder on the board, retinned the pad and replaced the resistor and all is working now.
